ygData.subject: Re: should we have to kill a fellow paladin for a sword??
ygData.msgSnippet: Strictly speaking, that would bring a Paladin to the same level as any warrior. Now, if that froglock would offer a quest of sorts to obtain this mighty
ygData.messageBody:
"Strictly speaking, that would bring a Paladin to the same level as any
warrior. Now, if that froglock would offer a quest of sorts to obtain this
mighty weapon, that would make more sense to me. This way killing it would
not be the best option to recieve it. It really depends on whether Verant
intends to be strict on role playing or whether let the players decide,
though that can in actuality hurt the fantasy realm if people don't play
along."

Muses, Reorn of Freeport.
-----Original Message-----
From: Brian Williams <gungho77@...>
To: EQPaladin <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 9:17 AM
Subject: [eqpaladin] should we have to kill a fellow paladin for a sword??


>From: "Brian Williams" <gungho77@...>
>
>Hail!! I am just looking for opinions on why you think Verant would put
>Ghoulsbane on a paladin NPC. As far as I know, the Froglok King is a good
>paladin and in order for us to obtain the Ghoulsbane, we have to kill him.
>In a role-playing sense, that is making a RPer make a tough decision. Stay
>in role and go without a powerful sword or just kill the big frog not
caring
>about what a paladin stands for.
>
> Abrell of Cazic
>
>
